fields.summary: Eclipse compiler is missing from codehaus repository

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The issue is not a bug
resolution.name: Not A Bug

fields.description:
I tried to follow  the instructions on http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-compiler-plugin/non-javac-compilers.html to use the eclipse compiler in my compiles. I have the following pom.xml:
{code:xml}
<plugin>
  <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
  <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
  <configuration>
    <showDeprecation>true</showDeprecation>
    <showWarnings>true</showWarnings>
    <compilerId>eclipse</compilerId>
    <source>1.5</source>
    <target>1.5</target>
  </configuration>
  <dependencies>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>plexus</groupId>
      <artifactId>plexus-compiler-eclipse</artifactId>
      <version>1.5</version>
    </dependency>
  </dependencies>
</plugin>
{code}
Note, that I did replace the <groupId>org.codehaus.plexus</groupId> with <groupId>plexus</groupId>, since there is no plexus-compiler-eclipse anymore in codehaus repo. Is this plugin not supported anymore?
Here is the exception I get:
{noformat}
[INFO] Defaulting prefixes to the single prefix 'com.avaloq.'.
Downloading: http://download.java.net/maven/2//com/avaloq/adt/org.junit.junit/3.8.2/org.junit.junit-3.8.2.pom

[INFO] [compiler:compile]
[FATAL ERROR] org.apache.maven.plugin.CompilerMojo#execute() caused a linkage error (java.lang.NoSuchMethodError) and may be out-of-date. Check the realms:
[FATAL ERROR] Plugin realm = app0.child-container[org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin]
urls[0] = file:/C:/Build/Maven-Repository/org/apache/maven/plugins/maven-compiler-plugin/2.0.2/maven-compiler-plugin-2.0.2.jar

[FATAL ERROR] Container realm = plexus.core

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Trace
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.codehaus.plexus.compiler.CompilerConfiguration.setOptimize(Z)V
        at org.apache.maven.plugin.AbstractCompilerMojo.execute(AbstractCompilerMojo.java:306)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

comments.body:
The same error occurs for plexus-compiler-javac

{code}
...
<configuration>
	<compilerId>javac</compilerId>
</configuration>
<dependencies>
	<dependency>
		<groupId>plexus</groupId>
		<artifactId>plexus-compiler-javac</artifactId>
		<version>1.5</version>
	</dependency>
</dependencies>
...
{code}

Try this instead which works for me:
{code:xml}
<build>
  <plugins>
    <plugin>
      <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
      <version>2.0.2</version>
      <configuration>
        <compilerId>eclipse</compilerId>
        <showDeprecation>true</showDeprecation>
        <showWarnings>true</showWarnings>
        <source>1.5</source>
        <target>1.5</target>
      </configuration>
      <dependencies>
        <dependency>
          <groupId>org.codehaus.plexus</groupId>
          <artifactId>plexus-compiler-eclipse</artifactId>
          <version>1.5.1</version>
        </dependency>
      </dependencies>
    </plugin>
  </plugins>
</build>
{code}
The version 1.5 you tried is apparently not compatible with the Maven Compiler Plugin.

Be warned that version 1.5.1 is the only version of plexus-compiler-eclipse currently available in the repo:
http://repo2.maven.org/maven2/org/codehaus/plexus/plexus-compiler-eclipse/
